title: Cache Memory
subject: Computer Organization
theory:
Small, fast memory between CPU and RAM. 
Stores frequently used data. 
Hit = Found in Cache (Fast). Miss = Go to RAM (Slow). 
Avg Access Time = HitTime + MissRate * MissPenalty.

interview_questions.question: Why is L1 separate for Data and Instruction?
interview_questions.answer: To allow fetching Instruction and Data simultaneously (Harvard Architecture principle) avoiding structural hazard.
